item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, February 2, 2025 at 1:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Reverse-engineering and analysis of SanDisk High Endurance microSDXC card (2020) (63 points | 5 comments)
2. Show HN: Lume – OS lightweight CLI for MacOS & Linux VMs on Apple Silicon. (44 points | 7 comments)
3. Life Is More Than an Engineering Problem – Interview with Ted Chiang (85 points | 12 comments)
4. Analyzing the codebase of Caffeine: a high performance caching library (58 points | 6 comments)
5. Fixing Left and Mutual Recursions in Grammars (48 points | 13 comments)
6. Show HN: ESP32 RC Cars (131 points | 19 comments)
7. Show HN: Modest – musical harmony library for Lua (20 points | 2 comments)
8. RLHF Book (263 points | 23 comments)
9. A Rust procedural language handler for PostgreSQL (52 points | 11 comments)
10. Pointers Are Complicated II, or: We need better language specs (2020) (111 points | 52 comments)
11. Recent results show that LLMs struggle with compositional tasks (205 points | 171 comments)
12. AstroForge selects target for "high risk, seat of the pants" asteroid mission (28 points | 3 comments)
13. Bzip3: A spiritual successor to BZip2 (273 points | 150 comments)
14. A bookmarklet to kill sticky headers (2013) (159 points | 65 comments)
15. Python 3, Pygame, and Debian Bookworm on the Miyoo A30 (130 points | 23 comments)
16. Show HN: I built a full mulimodal LLM by merging multiple models into one (22 points | 4 comments)
17. The Doctor Who Drank Infectious Broth and Solved a Medical Mystery (2010) (16 points | 16 comments)
18. Visualizing all books of the world in ISBN-Space (400 points | 81 comments)
19. LMD: A new, less wasteful metal 3D printing technique (78 points | 22 comments)
20. String of recent killings linked to Bay Area 'Zizians' (490 points | 631 comments)
21. Enhancing your MIDI devices with Perl (87 points | 16 comments)
22. I'm Ready for You: On Balzac (19 points | discuss)
23. CDC orders mass retraction and revision of submitted research (593 points | 366 comments)
24. The origin and unexpected evolution of the word "mainframe" (103 points | 28 comments)
25. Sound & Efficient Generation of DOP Exploits via Programming Language Synthesis [pdf] (7 points | discuss)
26. Archivists work to save disappearing data.gov datasets (580 points | 173 comments)
27. Fossilised fish vomit found in Denmark from sixty-six million years ago (4 points | discuss)
28. A mouseless tale: trying for a keyboard-driven desktop (98 points | 50 comments)
29. Macrodata Refinement (411 points | 226 comments)
30. Engineered waterways helped Ancient Amazonians became master maize farmers (31 points | 2 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, February 2, 2025 at 1:15 PM UTC
